column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Food: 3.5/5 I'm not sure if the price was equivalent to the taste of the ramen. We had the spicy tonkotsu ramen and the tonkotsu black. The spicy ramen wasn't as spicy as I was expecting
column2: and I asked for "hot". The chasu pork was very good
column3: it was full of flavor with the perfect amount of fat and meat. Wish it came with a soft boiled egg. The black ramen was full of flavor (a bit salty). The egg was cooked great! The noodles for this one was thinner than the spicy ramen
column4: which I'm not sure I liked bc I felt like I was getting less.
